intro: Clidemia silvicola, commonly known as the forest mallow, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences of white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist forest understories and has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Clidemia silvicola is often found in lowland to montane rainforests and plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
